string.text: LAKE YANTAR
Reach the mobile science lab

We arrived at the site of the operation. I've decided to leave Sky to protect the pilot. He's attempting to facilitate a connection to the satellite to keep us informed on what's happening here. The others and I have to examine the scientists' bunker. I hope we'll find all the answers we need there, as scouring the whole area won't be a pleasant experience.
Examine the area around the bunker
While Hottab deals with unlocking the bunker door, we ought to comb the area. Might find something useful.
Return to Hottab
It seems the bunker door is no longer in the way. Time to return to Hottab.
Gather all information in the bunker

Command's primary objective is to gather all information on the scientists' research at lake Yantar. We'll need to gather all documentation, personal PDAs of the scientists and data storage devices. I'll start with the bunker. I'll go on my own, as it'll be quieter.
Give the information to Sky

I gathered all the information I could found in the scientists' bunker. Everyone inside was either dead or turned into zombies — including Sakharov. The data I found needs to be given to Sky, and after decoding some of it, we'll decide how to proceed.
SOMETHING IN THE SILENCE
Talk to Vuslych
Vuslych saw something from his vantage point. I'll question him about it.
Talk to Koval
A strange anomaly has been spotted in the swamp by the mobile lab. Koval and I will go examine it. While we're at it, I'll put him through his paces.
Go to the anomaly site with Koval

One of our objectives from command is gathering all information on happenings at lake Yantar, including information on anomalous formations. I believe that's why Koval was assigned to our squad, being well-versed in anomalies.
Talk to Koval
The strange smoke disappeared as we got closer. I need to discuss what to do next with Koval.
Cover Koval
Koval claims he's never seen such an anomaly before. And was it even an anomaly? Gathering intelligence on it wouldn't hurt. While Koval sets up his device, I should provide cover.
SURVIVOR
Check the signal source
It appears someone survived. His PDA signal was picked up not far from us. Worth checking out.
Take the stalker to the camp

We've found the first survivor in Yantar. He should be able to clear up recent events and help give us a complete picture of everything. To begin with, I should take him to camp and let him come to his senses — he's been through a lot.
Interrogate the stalker
I should get as much information out of the stalker as possible. What does he know about the scientists' work at Yantar, what was that black fume chasing him? There are enough questions as it is.
DISAPPEARANCE
Find Koval
Koval's not answering his radio. I should examine the area where I last saw him.
Wait for Koval to appear
The dimwit disappeared somewhere. I don't believe anything happened to him. I'll wait until he shows up, and in the meantime, I can get around to other objectives.
Track down Koval by his signal
Koval's gone silent, but I've picked up his signal near the archanomaly. I'll check the area. What's he doing here?
Help Koval fight off the mutants
Koval ran into mutants by the anomaly. I should help him fight them off.
Talk to Koval
The mutants are dead. I need to find out what the hell made Koval go to the anomaly.
GATHERING INTEL
Talk to Sky
While I was away, Sky might've dug up something from the data we retrieved. I'll need to talk to him.
Get information in the marked locations

Sky transferred the possible sites of scientist bodies to my PDA. I should examine them and retrieve any information. Hottab and Vuslych set off to check the area leading to Agroprom. I'll check the area surrounding the factory.
Take the data to Sky
I found out some things on the spot, but I'll have to ask Sky about others. I'll bring him everything I got and let him do his thing.
BREACH
Activate the cooling station

To help us reach the body of one of the stalkers near laboratory X-16, Sky found a way to reduce the intensity of the psy-emissions around the lab's main entrance. The stalker may have useful information that will shed light on the events here.
Approach the stalker body
I managed to activate the cooling station and the emissions practically died down. Now I can get closer to the stalker by the breached wall.
Search the stalker body
I fell down into the laboratory ruins with the corpse... Well then, let's see whether he's got anything relevant to our mission.
CAUGHT IN A TRAP
Find the underground exit

I wound up inside the laboratory ruins with no way out. Seems I'm still in one piece, no fractures or anything, but my radio's broken to pieces. I'll have to get back on the surface on my own. On the plus side, this place will likely allow me to piece together everything that happened at Yantar.
Find a way inside the control room
Behind this door must be main control panel of this dreadful system. Perhaps I'll be able to find something useful there... but I first have to get inside.
Examine the dispatcher room
The dispatcher room might contain records of the scientists' final talks, or some other useful information.
Examine the control room
I managed to retrieve some key from the body of an army dispatcher. Let's hope he went from the control room, since not many doors here are locked.
Activate the cooling station
I managed to find certain information regarding the events in laboratory X-16. Now I need to get out of here.
Talk to Sky
Time to talk to our break-in specialist. He must have fished out something from the data we retrieved previously.
MYSTERIOUS STRANGER
Find the overnight shelter in the sewer

My encounter with Ivanych turned out unexpectedly. I never thought I'd get to see him alive again. He told me the individual we met around here is not to be trusted. How did he know about that? I'll need to question the stalker once more — Ivanych must have meant him. While I look for the exit, I'll check out his overnight shelter. Ivanych told me it's somewhere in the sewers.
Return to camp and decide how to proceed

A stalker named Matvei told me everything about the mysterious stranger. He lied to me from the very start with the sole purpose of getting out of here. Once I return to camp, I need to decide what to do with him. Leave him here? Take him with us and have him tried? Or even take on the role of judge myself?
SOURCE OF INTERFERENCE
Talk to Vuslych

We were able to retrieve almost all information about the events at Yantar. Now we only have to tacke the issue of the defective emitter. Vuslych will set off with me, along with Koval — I'd rather not leave him in camp.
Open the hangar
Professor Sytyanov may be located among zombies locked inside the hangar next to the mobile science lab. I should pry open the hangar, dispatch the zombies and retrieve his PDA.
Find Sytyanov's PDA
The hangar is open. Now I only have to deal with the zombies and find the data storage device on professor Sytyanov.
Wait for the data to be encrypted
I managed to find a PDA on professor Sytyanov's body. I'll wait until all data is extracted from it.
Reach the site
I learned about the location of the emitter. I have to reach the site with my squad and shut it off.
Find out what happened to Koval
Koval stopped all of a sudden. I should find out what happened.
Deactivate the emitter
We reached the target. Now we only have to turn off the emitter. Let's hope everything goes smoothly.
Return to the squad
The emitter is off. I should check up on the squad.
Return to the encampment

We've gathered all possible information on the incident and pieced together everything that happened at Yantar. Comms with Agroprom have been established. Time to return to camp and prepare to head back to base.
Talk to Sky
I need to give Sky the rest of all the information and prepare to depart to Agroprom.
MESSENGER OF JUSTICE
Decide what to do with the Duty deserter
Before heading back, I'll talk to the deserter. I must decide what to do with him.
